sen.j: 内海氏（うつみ し、うちうみ し、うちみ し、うちかい し）とは、日本の姓氏の１つ。
sen.e: The Utsumi clan, which is also known as the Uchiumi, Uchimi, or Uchikai clan, is one of Japanese family names.
The Utsumi clan (also known as the Uchiumi, the Uchimi, or the Uchikai clan) is a Japanese family name.
The Utsumi clan (also known as the Uchiumi, the Uchimi, or the Uchikai clan) is a Japanese family name.

sen.j: 出自には下記に記す諸流がある。
sen.e: The clan has originally several lines as follows.
The clan has originally several lines as follows.
The clan has originally several lines as follows.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇の皇子鐸石別命の裔の1人である清麿（清麻呂？）が、大功により和気朝臣を賜姓され、その子孫が内海氏を称した。
sen.e: Kiyomaro, a descendant of Nuteshiwake no Mikoto, who is Emperor Suinin's son, was bestowed a surname "Wake Ason" because of his distinguished service, and his descendants called themselves "the Utsumi clan."

Kiyomaro, a descendant of Nuteshiwake no Mikoto, who was Emperor Suinin's son, was bestowed the ason surname of "Wake," because of his distinguished service, and his descendants called themselves "the Utsumi clan."
sen.cmt: rewording;change verb tense;replace punctuation symbols;the logic of the sentence is difficult to comprehend
sen.e: Kiyomaro, a descendant of Nuteshiwake no Mikoto, who was Emperor Suinin's son, was bestowed the ason surname of "Wake," because of his distinguished service, and his descendants called themselves "the Utsumi clan."

sen.j: 敏達天皇の皇子難波皇子の裔の1人である美努王の妻県犬養三千代が、橘氏朝臣の賜姓された事によって子息である橘諸兄・橘佐為も橘姓を名乗った。
sen.e: Minu no Okimi, a descendant of Prince Naniwa, Emperor Bidatsu's son, had a wife named Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, who was bestowed a surname "the Tachibana clan Asomi," and her sons, TACHIBANA no Moroe and TACHIBANA no Sai, called themselves "TACHIBANA."

Minu no Okimi, a descendant of Prince Naniwa, who was Emperor Bidatsu's son, had a wife named Agata no Inukai no Michiyo, who was bestowed the ason surname of "Tachibana," and her sons, Tachibana no Moroe and Tachibana no Sai, continued to use the Tachibana family name.
sen.cmt: rewording;replace punctuation symbols;correct inconsistencies in capitalization of names
sen.e: Minu no Okimi, a descendant of Prince Naniwa, who was Emperor Bidatsu's son, had a wife named Agata no Inukai no Michiyo, who was bestowed the ason surname of "Tachibana," and her sons, Tachibana no Moroe and Tachibana no Sai, continued to use the Tachibana family name.

sen.j: この両名の子孫が内海氏を称した。
sen.e: The two sons' descendants called themselves "the Utsumi clan."
The descendants of these two sons called themselves the "Utsumi clan."
The descendants of these two sons called themselves the "Utsumi clan."

sen.j: 清和天皇の皇子貞純親王の裔清和源氏の1人、攝津源氏である源頼光の子孫が土岐氏である。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu was a member of Seiwa-Genji, who were descendants of Imperial Prince Sadazumi, Emperor Seiwa's son, and descendants of MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu, Settsu-Genji, were the Toki clan.

Minamoto no Yorimitsu was a member of the Seiwa-Genji, who were descendants of Imperial Prince Sadazumi, Emperor Seiwa's son, and the descendants of Minamoto no Yorimitsu, who belonged to the Settsu-Genji, were the Toki clan.

Minamoto no Yorimitsu was a member of the Seiwa-Genji, who were descendants of Imperial Prince Sadazumi, Emperor Seiwa's son, and the descendants of Minamoto no Yorimitsu, who belonged to the Settsu-Genji, were the Toki clan.

sen.j: その土岐氏の中の土岐頼貞の子孫が内海氏を称した。
sen.e: Descendants of Yorisada TOKI, a member of the Toki clan, called themselves "the Utsumi clan."
The descendants of Yorisada Toki, who belonged to the Toki clan, called themselves the "Utsumi clan."
The descendants of Yorisada Toki, who belonged to the Toki clan, called themselves the "Utsumi clan."
